page.title: 02Denbigh Castle c 1284-1322
page.content: Local history is dominated by this {Edwardian castle,}which due to its strategic position, commanding view and proximity to the English border, enabled{Denbigh}to develop as a military town. The castle and walled town, both classed as{Grade 1 ancient {monuments,}form one of the largest fortressed areas in{Wales.}It is still well defined with the{Burgess gate, {towers}and the{castle gatehouse, comprising 3 octagonal towers, well preserved. Inside the castle's small {museum and exhibition}reminds us that {H.M.Stanley, of Livingstone fame,}was born nearby. After recent repair work the castle walls were re-opened{May {11th 1985}by the{Mayor}and once again from their heights the visitors are able to enjoy the breathtaking views of the{Vale of Clwyd.
